sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's Friday the 14th of January. Good morning, Europe. I'm Sarah Green. Thanks for joining us on Euronews. Our headlines this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Warnings that the risk of war in Europe is the highest it's been in decades after a week of diplomatic talks fails to ease tensions over Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Britain's Prince Andrew is stripped of his military and royal titles as he fights allegations of sexual assault.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And the body of David Sassoli, the late president of the European Parliament, lies in state in Rome ahead of his funeral later today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: No breakthrough. That's how a third round of diplomatic talks between NATO and Russia

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: have concluded at the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe in Vienna. Poland, which chaired the meeting, warned that Europe is at risk of plunging into war. The White House National Security Adviser said the risk of a Russian invasion of Ukraine was high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We've now completed an intensive week of diplomacy in multiple formats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia raised its concerns, we raised our concerns, including the actions Russia has taken to undermine European security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We're prepared to continue with diplomacy to advance security and stability in the Euro-Atlantic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We're equally prepared if Russia chooses a different path.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: in the Euro-Atlantic. We're equally prepared if Russia chooses a different path.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Russian deputy foreign minister refused to rule out the possibility of sending military assets to Cuba and Venezuela if NATO doesn't stop military activities on Russia's doorstep.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Russian president has spoken many times on this subject in particular, what the military actions should be within the Russian Navy if anything goes towards provoking Russia and the further enhancement of military pressure from the US side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We don't want this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Diplomats must negotiate." Jamie Shea is a former NATO deputy assistant secretary general. He says what happens next is up to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The ball is in Putin's court. Is he interested in a dialogue, in some kind of negotiation, or is all of this posturing on the Russian side to maximize our unacceptable demands, not seek any solution, and then simply use a failure of talks, which were doomed to fail in any way, as a pretext to invade Ukraine. Lithuania shares a border with Russia and it says the threat of war is greater than at any time since 1945. Now it's preparing for the worst.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: 1945. Now it's preparing for the worst. After the third unsuccessful Ukraine summit this week, the mood in Europe's diplomatic arena is downbeat. Russia warns of a crisis with unforeseeable consequences for Europe's security. And Poland, which as a NATO member sits on the other side of the negotiating table, has a similar assessment of the situation. For 30 years, Europe would never have been as close to war as it is now. A strong statement. Poland apparently wants to use its recently assumed OSCE chairmanship to draw more attention to the ongoing war in its neighboring country, with the help of an upcoming visit by the Chair to Eastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Sabre-rattling in the east, inflexibility in the west.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia's demand to stop NATO's eastward expansion before Ukraine is apparently not being taken into consideration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Moscow sees the ever-closer NATO military bases as aggression.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And at the same time, the West sees the Russian troop deployments towards the Ukrainian border as aggression as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And after three diplomatic summits, first in Geneva, then in Brussels, and finally in Vienna, the two sides have apparently not gotten much closer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However, one ray of hope remains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The door to diplomacy is still open, as both the Americans and the Russians affirm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: With regard to the Ukraine issue, Europe must apparently prepare itself for slow diplomacy, based on a well-known recipe, sabre-rattling and stubbornness on both sides, of what is at the very least an open door.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Johannes Blechbecker, Euronews, Vienna.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: With Western leaders putting the ball back in Moscow's court, Euronews Russian analyst Galina Polonskaya says the country is warned it will take action if its proposals go unheeded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia condemned the refusal of the US and NATO to accept its principal demands, calling the security talks unsuccessful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin's spokesman Dmitry Peskov told journalists there were disagreements on issues fundamental for Russia and that it was bad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Rybkov, who headed up the delegation at the US talks, said that discussions had so far run into a dead end. Moscow says it's now waiting for a written response from Washington and NATO to decide on its next move. Russia's permanent representative to the OSCE, Alexander Lukashevich has warned that Moscow will take all necessary measures if its proposals remain unanswered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He says if the parties fail to agree on lines that can't be crossed, catastrophic consequences will ensue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But top Russian officials won't say exactly what those measures will be, adding that Russia has no plan to attack Ukraine. The final decision on the next step stays with the President Putin. Galina Polonskaya for EU News.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Britain's Prince Andrew has been stripped of his honorary military titles and his royal patronages have been returned to the Queen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Earlier this week a US judge ruled that a sexual assault case against the British royal

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: could go ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In a statement Buckingham Palace announced that the Duke of York, who denies the allegations, will defend his case as a private citizen and will not be undertaking any public duties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Royal commentator Richard Fitzwilliams told Euronews that the Queen had little choice but to distance herself and the monarchy from the scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It was undoubtedly the right decision at the beginning of her platinum jubilee year, but also in response to some anger from veterans and also to a lengthy catalogue of what I can only describe as catastrophic mistakes by Andrew. All the options open to him, whether he ignores the court, which is in New York, whether he attempts a settlement, which could be seen as part of his admission of guilt if it can be negotiated, or if he were actually to take part in some form of court trial, all of these look bad for him, as does his behaviour and his choice of friends, including that grotesque interview on BBC News Night in November 2019.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Italian politicians joined ordinary citizens to pay respect to the European Parliament President David Sassoli, who died early this week and whose coffin was placed in Rome's town hall ahead of a state funeral.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: President Mattarella and Prime Minister Draghi, as well as the mayor of his hometown, paid homage to the politician.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Sassoli's political legacy is clear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Europe must be united and able to speak with one voice with regards to major international issues instead of hesitating like it has done in the past.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Sassoli's Europe was all about that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But we still have to build up that idea of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: That's his legacy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I have his mocha.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Sassoli was hospitalized in September due to pneumonia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Just after Christmas, he was hospitalized again with a dysfunction of the immune system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: His term ahead of the EU Parliament, which was meant to end this month, was marked by what many described as the human face of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Sassoli's manners were gentle and kind, but at the same time clear and defined. This could inspire a new form of communication in politics and a new way of doing politics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I believe that a more collective and kind leadership and a more inclusive one is the way forward, both for Italy and for other European countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: David Sassoli's funeral service will take place on Friday in the Basilica of Santa Maria degli'Aglianzelli in the center of Rome.
